messages.content: What is the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node used for?
The 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node is a simple node used to load images from either a local file path or an HTTP URL.
In which category of nodes can I find the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node?
You can find the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node under the 'image' category.
How do I specify the input for the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node?
The input for the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node is specified via the 'inputs' property with a key called 'url_or_path'.
What is the expected format of the 'url_or_path' input for the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node?
The 'url_or_path' input for the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node expects either a valid URL or a local file path to an image.
What is the 'class_type' specified under the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node?
The 'class_type' specified under the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node is 'LoadImageFromUrlOrPath'.
What is the '_meta.title' specified under the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node?
The '_meta.title' specified under the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node is 'LoadImageFromUrlOrPath'.
What is an example of a valid 'url_or_path' input for the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node?
An example of a valid 'url_or_path' input for the 'ComfyUI-load-image-from-url' node could be a URL like 'https://i.postimg.cc/TYbdk63X/test.png' or a local file path like 'C:\path\to\image.png'.
